titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Women Writing Women's Lives Records TAM 316
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hillel Arnold

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-07-21T12:29-0400

did.unittitle: Women Writing Women's Lives Records
did.abstract: Founded in 1990, Women Writing Women’s Lives is an ongoing seminar of about sixty women engaged in writing book-length biographies and memoirs, affiliated with the Center for the Study of Women and Society and the Center for the Humanities at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York. Members meet monthly to present work for discussion, share ideas, and hear about the work of outside presenters. The collection consists of administrative files, subject files, and notes and lectures from the group’s monthly meetings.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Women Writing Women’s Lives Records were given to the Tamiment Library in January 2004 by Kathy Chamberlain, Steering Committee Chair.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: peter.filardo@nyu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Women Writing Women's Lives; Tamiment #316; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive; New York University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1990, Women Writing Women’s Lives is an ongoing seminar of about sixty women engaged in writing book-length biographies and memoirs. Its members include academics, poets, journalists and novelists. Women Writing Women's Lives is under the aegis of the Center for the Study of Women and Society and the Center for the Humanities at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York.
Monthly meetings, planned by a Steering Committee, are arranged in order for members to present work for discussion, share ideas, and hear about the work of outside presenters.

list.item: Women Writing Women’s Lives (WWWL) Seminar. http://web.gc.cuny.edu/womencenter/wwwl/

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The General Files consist of administrative records such as membership applications and questionnaires, financial records, and minutes of the Steering Committee meetings. Clipping and subject files on topics related to women’s biography and biographers are also included.
The Session Records contain announcements, attendance sheets, lectures and notes from the organization’s monthly meetings. Names of lecturers are indicated in the folder title.
Box IV consists of unprocessed materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: I, General Files: Arranged alphabetically. II, Sessions Records: Arranged chronologically
